Localised content - no document page: There are no British consular facilities to get legal documents to prove you’re eligible to marry in Afghanistan.
Your partner must attend your appointment with you.
American Samoa is a territory of the United States and you need to follow the correct process according to American law.
There are no British consular facilities to get legal documents to prove you’re eligible to marry in Andorra.
There are no British consular facilities to get legal documents to prove you’re eligible to marry in Anguilla.

If you’re asked to provide a certificate of no impediment or marital status affirmation, explain that the UK does not issue these for Commonwealth countries. Check if there’s a [standard letter to help explain this](https://www.gov.uk/guidance/confirm-a-notarial-or-document-service-is-not-available).

If you are divorced, Argentinian authorities will ask for evidence of your divorce. If you divorced in the UK, you should give them your divorce decree absolute and this [letter from the embassy](https://assets.publishing.service.gov.uk/media/6531456126b9b1000daf1c17/Information_Note_-_Validity_of_Marriages.pdf).

Civil partnership: or register an opposite-sex civil partnership
Localised content - no document page:
Aruba is a territory of the Netherlands and you need to follow the correct process according to Dutch law.
You'll need to complete a personal declaration when you tell the Dutch authorities you intend to get married.
The British Embassy cannot give you a declaration of single status. If the Dutch authorities ask you for a declaration of single status you can show them [this letter](https://assets.publishing.service.gov.uk/media/60c9f56dd3bf7f4bd73867a1/CNI_Explanatory_Letter_British_Embassy_The_Hague.pdf) explaining they're not issued any more.

If you’re asked to provide a certificate of no impediment or marital status affirmation, explain that the UK does not issue these for Commonwealth countries. Check if there’s a [standard letter to help explain this](https://www.gov.uk/guidance/confirm-a-notarial-or-document-service-is-not-available).
You can swear an affirmation that you’re free to get married in front of a [local notary public](https://find-a-professional-service-abroad.service.csd.fcdo.gov.uk/find/lawyers).
You can apply for a no trace letter from the [General Register Office](https://www.gov.uk/general-register-office).

Additional documentation: *Austrian residence certificate (‘Meldebestätigung’) with a registered ‘Hauptwohnsitz’ - if you or your partner live in Austria (this should also be used as proof of address)
Localised content - start pages:
Before you apply you must have a confirmed date for your ceremony from your registry office (Standesamt) in Austria.
If you or your partner are legally resident in Austria, the proof of residence must be an Austrian residence certificate (‘Meldebestätigung’) with a registered ‘Hauptwohnsitz’.

Eligibility info: To get married in Azerbaijan either:*your partner must be an Azerbaijani national*you and your partner must have temporary residence to work or study in Azerbaijan

Eligibility info: To get married in Belarus you or your partner must be a Belarusian national or have permanent residency in Belarus.

Localised content - no document page:
If you're getting married, you'll need to [apply by post for a 'certificate of custom and law for marriage'](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/affidavitaffirmation-of-marital-status-form-belgium) from the British Consulate General Brussels.
If you're registering a civil partnership, you may be asked for a certificate of marital status, signed by a [local notary public](https://find-a-professional-service-abroad.service.csd.fcdo.gov.uk/find/lawyers) in Belgium.

Additional documentation: *premarital medical certificate *partner’s premarital medical certificate *if you live in Benin - your residence certificate (this serves as your proof of address)  *copy of your witness's passport or national identity card

There are no British consular facilities that will issue a CNI in Benin.
You will need to travel to the British High Commission Accra in Ghana to give notice and collect your CNI.

You will also need to give the registrar in Bolivia a legalised (apostilled) birth certificate. You need to [apply for legalisation separately](https://www.gov.uk/get-document-legalised).

Localised content - no document page: If you live overseas, you will be asked to sign a marital status affirmation in front of the Czech registration officer (Matrika). They will provide you with guidance on how to do this. The British Embassy Prague cannot administer marital affirmations.

You'll need a certificate of marital status from Denmark's [Agency of Family Law](https://familieretshuset.dk/en/your-life-situation/your-life-situation/international-marriages). If you live, or recently lived, in the UK the Danish authorities may also ask for a no trace letter from [the General Register Office](https://www.gov.uk/general-register-office) to confirm your marital status.

To get married ("matrimonio") you will need a certificate of no impediment (CNI).
If you live in the UK, you can [get a CNI from a UK register office](/before-you-start/apply-for-uk-cni?marriage.country=Ecuador). Your UK CNI will then need to be [legalised](https://www.gov.uk/get-document-legalised) and [translated](https://find-a-professional-service-abroad.service.csd.fcdo.gov.uk/find/translators-interpreters) before it will be accepted by Ecuadorian Civil Registry Office (Registro Civil). Alternatively, you can [exchange your UK CNI](/exchange-uk-cni/check-eligibility-and-documents?marriage.country=Ecuador) at the British Embassy Quito.
If you live in Ecuador or somewhere else outside of the UK you will need to [apply for a CNI](/cni/check-eligibility-and-documents?marriage.country=Ecuador) from the British Embassy Quito.
If you are registering a civil partnership (“union de hecho”) you will need to [apply for a marital status affirmation](/affirmation/check-eligibility-and-the-documents-you-need?marriage.country=Ecuador) from the British Embassy Quito.
Check with the Ecuadorian Civil Registry Office (Registro Civil) to make sure you are applying for the correct document.
Localised content - UK CNI accepted:

Your UK CNI will then need to be [legalised](https://www.gov.uk/get-document-legalised) and [translated](https://find-a-professional-service-abroad.service.csd.fcdo.gov.uk/find/translators-interpreters) before it will be accepted by Ecuadorian Civil Registry Office (Registro Civil). Alternatively, you can [exchange your UK CNI](/exchange-uk-cni/check-eligibility-and-documents?marriage.country=Ecuador) at the British Embassy Quito.

Additional documentation: *residence permit card issued by Finnish Immigration Service (or equivalent for the country you live in) – this serves as your proof of address *partner's DVV certificate (this can also be their proof of address)
Localised content - start pages:
To apply for an affirmation in Finland you must live outside the UK. Upload your residence permit card as your proof of address and bring it to your appointment. If you cannot prove that you are resident outside the UK do not apply for this service.
If you live in the UK, you'll need to [give notice](https://www.gov.uk/marriages-civil-partnerships/give-notice) at a UK register office to get a certificate of no impediment (CNI). [Follow the guidance for British nationals living in the UK](https://www.gov.uk/marriage-abroad) to find out how to apply.

Localised content - no document page:
You might be asked for a: *certificate of celibacy (‘certificat de célibat’)*certificate of custom (‘certificat de coutume’)
The UK government does not issue these documents. Instead, read the guidance on [completing a self-declaration form](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/self-declaration-form-for-marriage-or-civil-partnership-pacs-in-france).

French Guiana is a territory of France and you need to follow the correct process according to French law. You might be asked for a: *certificate of celibacy (‘certificat de célibat’)*certificate of custom (‘certificat de coutume’)

If you live abroad you’ll need an exemption (‘Befreiung von der Beibringung des Ehefähigkeitszeugnisses’) from the Higher Regional Court (‘Oberlandesgericht’) responsible for the registration district where you live. Your local registry office (‘Standesamt’) can help with this process.

Localised content - start pages:
The marital status affirmation you'll swear will be slightly different depending on your type of marriage.
For Islamic marriages at the Sharia Court, you’ll swear a single declaration document to prove you’re allowed to marry or a single divorced declaration document if you’re divorced.
For Christian marriages, you’ll swear a marital status affidavit.
You can use this service to apply for the single declarations and marital status affidavits. Before your appointment, the British Embassy in Amman will contact you to ask which document you need.

Whether you can get married in Kuwait depends on your gender and religion.
If you’re a Muslim man, you can marry a Muslim or non-Muslim woman in an Islamic marriage. Contact the [Kuwait Ministry of Justice](https://www.moj.gov.kw/en/Pages/default.aspx) to understand what you need to do.
If you’re a Muslim woman, you can marry a Muslim man in an Islamic marriage. You cannot marry a non-Muslim man. Contact the [Kuwait Ministry of Justice](https://www.moj.gov.kw/en/Pages/default.aspx) to understand what you need to do. You may need a [CNI issued in the UK](/before-you-start/apply-for-uk-cni?marriage.country=Kuwait).
If you're a non-Muslim man or woman and your partner is also non-Muslim you can marry in a Christian marriage. You will need a [CNI issued in the UK](/before-you-start/apply-for-uk-cni?marriage.country=Kuwait).

Eligibility info: To get married in Kyrgyzstan your partner must be a Kyrgyz national.
To get married in Laos your partner must be a Lao national.

Localised content - no document page:
If you’re asked to provide a certificate of no impediment or marital status affirmation, explain that the UK does not issue these for Commonwealth countries. Check if there’s a [standard letter to help explain this](https://www.gov.uk/guidance/confirm-a-notarial-or-document-service-is-not-available).
You can swear an affirmation that you’re free to get married in front of a [local notary public or commissioner of oaths](https://find-a-professional-service-abroad.service.csd.fcdo.gov.uk/find/lawyers).
You can apply for a no trace letter from the [General Register Office](https://www.gov.uk/general-register-office).
There are no British consular facilities to get legal documents to prove you’re eligible to marry in Liberia.
There are no British consular facilities to get legal documents to prove you’re eligible to marry in Libya.

Ask if they would accept a UK certificate of no impediment (CNI) issued by a UK register office. Localised content - no document page:
You'll need to complete a personal declaration when you tell the Dutch authorities you intend to get married.
The British Embassy cannot give you a declaration of single status. If the Dutch authorities ask you for a declaration of single status you can show them [this letter](https://assets.publishing.service.gov.uk/media/60c9f56dd3bf7f4bd73867a1/CNI_Explanatory_Letter_British_Embassy_The_Hague.pdf) explaining they're not issued any more.

Additional documentation: *proof you live in Norway (this should also be your proof of address)
Localised content - start pages:
Appointments are only available at the British Embassy Oslo. You will need to travel to Oslo for your appointment.
To apply for an affirmation you must be a resident in Norway. Your proof of address must be issued by a Norwegian Authority. If you cannot prove that you are a Norwegian resident do not apply for this service.
If you live in the UK, you'll need to [give notice](https://www.gov.uk/marriages-civil-partnerships/give-notice) at a UK register office to get a certificate of no impediment (CNI). [Follow the guidance for British nationals living in the UK](https://www.gov.uk/marriage-abroad) to find out how to apply."

Localised content - start pages: You will also need to provide your legalised (apostilled) birth certificate. You need to [apply for legalisation separately](https://www.gov.uk/get-document-legalised).

Localised content - UK CNI accepted:
Your UK CNI will need to be legalised (apostilled) to be accepted by the Filipino authorities. You need to [apply for legalisation separately](https://www.gov.uk/get-document-legalised) once you have your UK CNI.
It may be helpful for you to include a copy of the [Philippines Statistics Authority Memorandum Circular](https://assets.publishing.service.gov.uk/media/657fa6861c0c2a000d18cebe/MC-Process-for-British-Nationals-Who-Wish-to-Obtain-Marriage-License-in-the-Philippines_CAHC-signed.pdf) with your legalised UK CNI. It explains the documents British nationals resident in the UK need when getting married in the Philippines.
Localised content - start pages:
Once you’ve applied online, print out either an [affirmation](https://assets.publishing.service.gov.uk/media/6583f40f23b70a0013234d53/Affirmation_of_Marital_Status.odt) (if you want to make a non-religious declaration) or [affidavit](https://assets.publishing.service.gov.uk/media/6583f3fc23b70a000d234d53/Affidavit_of_Marital_Status.odt) (religious). Fill in your details by hand but do not sign yet. You must bring your completed form with you to your appointment at your embassy or consulate and sign it then.
You must be a resident outside of the UK to apply for this service. If you live in the UK, you need to [apply for a UK CNI](/before-you-start/apply-for-uk-cni?marriage.country=Philippines) before travelling to the Philippines.

Alternatively, you can [apply to exchange your UK CNI](/exchange-uk-cni/check-eligibility-and-documents?marriage.country=Russia) for a local CNI at the British embassy or consulate in Russia.

Eligibility info:
[Check with the Swedish Tax Authorities](https://www.skatteverket.se/privat.4.76a43be412206334b89800052864.html) to find out whether you need a CNI. Only apply for this service if you are not registered in the Swedish population register. If you are registered, you should not need a CNI to get married.
If you live in the UK you should [apply for a CNI from a UK register office](/exchange-uk-cni/check-eligibility-and-documents?marriage.country=Sweden) unless you have already travelled to Sweden.
Additional documentation: *partner's extract from the population register (if they're registered in Sweden)
Localised content - UK CNI accepted:
Contact the [Swedish Tax Authorities](https://www.skatteverket.se/privat.4.76a43be412206334b89800052864.html) to find out what documents you will need to get married in Sweden.
If you live abroad or in Sweden and are not registered in the Swedish population register you'll probably need to [apply for a CNI online](https://prove-eligibility-foreign-government.forms.fcodev.org.uk/cni/check-eligibility-and-documents?marriage.country=Sweden) and attend an appointment at the British Embassy Stockholm.

If you live in the UK you should [apply for a CNI from a UK register office](/exchange-uk-cni/check-eligibility-and-documents?marriage.country=Sweden) unless you have already travelled to Sweden.

If you’re asked to provide a certificate of no impediment or marital status affirmation, explain that the UK does not issue these for Commonwealth countries. Check if there’s a [standard letter to help explain this](https://www.gov.uk/guidance/confirm-a-notarial-or-document-service-is-not-available).
You can swear an affirmation that you’re free to get married in front of a [local notary public](https://find-a-professional-service-abroad.service.csd.fcdo.gov.uk/find/lawyers).
You can apply for a no trace letter from the [General Register Office](https://www.gov.uk/general-register-office).

Check if there’s a [standard letter to help explain this](https://www.gov.uk/guidance/confirm-a-notarial-or-document-service-is-not-available).

You can apply for a no trace letter from the [General Register Office](https://www.gov.uk/general-register-office).
There are no British consular facilities to get legal documents to prove you’re eligible to marry in Timor-Leste.

Additional documentation: *premarital medical certificate *partner’s premarital medical certificate *if you live in Togo - your residence certificate (this serves as your proof of address)  *copy of your witness's passport or national identity card
Localised content - start pages:
There are no British consular facilities that will issue a CNI in Togo.
You will need to travel to the British High Commission Accra in Ghana to give notice and collect your CNI.

Eligibility info:
To have a religious ceremony in a church or Sharia court you or your partner must be a resident in the United Arab Emirates.
If neither you or your partner live in the United Arab Emirates you can have a civil ceremony at the Abu Dhabi Judicial Department.

Civil partnership: or register a same-sex civil partnership
Localised content - no document page:
You will need to provide a legalised (apostilled) birth certificate that has been translated into Spanish. If you are divorced or widowed you will also need to get your decree absolute or partner's death certificate legalised and translated into Spanish.
You need to [apply for legalisation separately](https://www.gov.uk/get-document-legalised). The translation must be done by an [Uruguayan Public Translator](https://find-a-professional-service-abroad.service.csd.fcdo.gov.uk/find/translators-interpreters).

Eligibility info: In Vanuatu you must be over 21 to get married.
Localised content - no document page:
If you’re asked to provide a certificate of no impediment or marital status affirmation, explain that the UK does not issue these for Commonwealth countries.
There are no British consular facilities to get legal documents to prove you’re eligible to marry in Vanuatu.
You can swear an affirmation that you’re free to get married in front of a [local notary public](https://find-a-professional-service-abroad.service.csd.fcdo.gov.uk/find/lawyers).
You can apply for a no trace letter from the [General Register Office](https://www.gov.uk/general-register-office).

Localised content - UK CNI accepted:
Your UK CNI will need to be [legalised](https://www.gov.uk/get-document-legalised) and translated into Spanish. You may need to get additional documents legalised and translated. Check with the person conducting your ceremony.
Alternatively, you can [apply to exchange your UK CNI](/exchange-uk-cni/check-eligibility-and-documents?marriage.country=Venezuela) for a local CNI at the British embassy.

Eligibility info: Check what documents you’ll need with the local People’s Committee - known in Vietnam as the Uy Ban Nhan Dan (UBND) - in the region of Vietnam you’re getting married in.
Duration: 3 or 6 months (check with the local People's Committee)
Localised content - start pages: Your proof of any previous marriages having ended (for example your divorce absolute or partner's death certificate) must be legalised if they were issued in the UK. You need to [apply for legalisation separately](https://www.gov.uk/get-document-legalised).

Localised content - no document page:
Wallis and Futuna is a territory of France and you need to follow the correct process according to French law. You might be asked for a: *certificate of celibacy (‘certificat de célibat’)*certificate of custom (‘certificat de coutume’)
The UK government does not issue these documents. Instead, read the guidance on [completing a self-declaration form](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/self-declaration-form-for-marriage-or-civil-partnership-pacs-in-france).
There are no British consular facilities to get legal documents to prove you’re eligible to marry in Western Sahara.
